title.rendered: Download Visual Studio/VS Code from Microsoft Store

content.rendered:
Visual Studio Code, developed by Microsoft, is an integrated development environment (IDE) that has been designed for Windows, Linux, and macOS. VS Code supports the features such as debugging, intelligent code completion, syntax highlighting, embedded Git, snippets, and code refactoring. It allows the users to change and apply themes of their choice, set keyboard shortcuts, set preferences, and install extensions for further performing abilities and facilitates the software development process.

Having been released 20 years back, Visual Studio has its initial version Visual Studio 97. It has since seen developments and enhancements in its establishments with the addition of lot more features. The latest version existing today is Microsoft Visual Studio 2019.

The VS IDE comes with a range of existing extensions in the market. It includes the extensions for C++, together with some of the extensions given below-

  • Visual Assist
  • Code Runner
  • ReSharper C++ 
  • CodeMaid
  • Code Compare
  • Backtrace Crashpad Integration 
  • FastFind

Benefits of Visual Studio

If you are wondering whether to download the Visual Studio/VS Code from the Microsoft store or not, you can consider the advantages of downloading the IDE for your respective operating systems. Some of the benefits it offers include:

  • It supports many languages in C++
  • It is available with many extensions
  • Available in its free version
  • It’s of great use to developers

Is Visual Code accessible for free?

You can get the free version of Visual Code’s basic community edition that is available fully-featured and expandable for further advancements. This free IDE version is ideal to develop applications for Android, iOS, Windows, including cloud services. It can be used by anyone including students, and individual developers. If you are looking forward to grabbing the IDE in its professional, it will cost you somewhere around $45.00/month, along with a free trial version.
